xpath.name: Type Coercion
xpath.problem: The function $nth attempts to return the nth item of a sequence or an array. While it works fine for sequences even with negative indices, if an array is passed to it, a dynamic error will be raised. Can you modify the function so that it performs an explicit type coercion on its 2nd argument to prevent any dynamic errors? Think of a type that will work always for both sequences and arrays.
Modify the query to output _test_ using the pipeline operator.

problem.div: 1. Modify the query to output the same text as before but use the string template instead.
2. (bonus) add a Sentence to the output how many persons' id's start with a character.
Look at the two solutions that both compute the cubes of each entry in the input sequence. The first one is using the arrow operator ( => ) the second one uses the bang operator ( ! ).
Can you rewrite the first solution to use the arrow bang operator ( =!> )?
